metadata.title: CVE-2023-33460 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
There's a memory leak in yajl 2.1.0 with use of yajl_tree_parse function.which will cause out-of-memory in server and cause crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-33460` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libyajl2 - 2.0.4-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
yajl-tools - 2.0.4-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: argyll: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
argyll: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
yajl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.4-4ubuntu0.1~esm1').
